dataset.title: Dataset: Sediment depth and accretion shape belowground mangrove carbon stocks across a range of climatic and geologic settings
dataset.abstract: We assessed the limits of mangrove sedimentary carbon storage by sampling sediments in diverse mangrove environments across four geographic areas: the volcanic Galapagos, the arid Baja Peninsula, and the geologically and climatically distinct Caribbean and Pacific coasts of Panama. At 80 sites across these areas, we quantified the organic carbon density, sampled with depth, of entire sediment columns. Most sites were cored in several locations, generally across an intertidal transect. Sediment depth, bulk density, and organic carbon density were measured with depth in each core. Some cores also had one or more sample depth radiocarbon dated, allowing for estimates of long-term accretion rates. Depth-integrated carbon stocks are highly variable, from < 17 to > 1700 MgCorg ha-1.
dataset.intellectualRights: This dataset is listed under a Creative Commons BY 4.0 and can be used with attribution. https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Unique identification code used to distinguish cores or sampling intervals that were collected or processed using different methods.
Code indicating what type of device was used to collect soil depth profiles.

codeDefinition.definition: A half cylinder coring device with the coring section sealed off by a fin attached to a rotating pivot point

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether live roots were included or excluded from carbon assessments.

codeDefinition.definition: Roots and rhizomes were included in dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether or not sediment was sieved prior to carbon measurements.

codeDefinition.definition: Sediment was sieved prior to analysis for organics

attribute.attributeDefinition: If sediment was sieved, the size of sieve used.
Code indicating how the authors qualified or quantified compaction of the core.

codeDefinition.definition: Authors specified that the coring device's design minimized compaction

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density. This can include either samples that were freeze dried or oven dried.
Any notable codes regarding how the authors quantified dry bulk density.

codeDefinition.definition: Bulk density was not measured, but was modeled from loss on ignition and assumptions about the particle densities of organic and inorganic matter
Bulk density methodology did not specify drying temperature or length, only that samples were dried to a constant mass

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Sample volume used for loss on ignition, if held constant.
Code indicating whether fraction carbon was measured or estimated as a function of organic matter.

codeDefinition.definition: Fraction carbon was measured as opposed to modeled
Fraction carbon was modeled as opposed to measured.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether or not carbonates were removed prior to calculating fraction organic carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were not removed before measuring organic carbon
Carbonates were removed before measuring organic carbon.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The method used to remove carbonates prior to measuring fraction carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were removed by fumigating with concentrated acid
Organic carbon fraction was measured without removing carbonates assuming carbonate content of the soil type was minimal

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method for which fraction carbon was measured or modeled (Note: regression based models are permitted, but the use of the Bemmelen factor [0.58 gOC gOM-1] is discouraged).

codeDefinition.definition: Each sample presented was measured using Elemental Analysis
A regression model fit using a subset of measurements was used to predict fraction carbon as a function of fraction organic matter

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether fraction_carbon refers to organic or total carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Author specified that fraction carbon measurements were of organic carbon

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any other submitter defined notes describing methodologies for determining dry bulk density, organic matter fraction, and carbon fraction.
Code indicating the method used for determining radiocarbon activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Accelerator mass spectroscopy used

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any submitter defined notes elaborating on the process of dating the core not yet made clear by the coding.
Code indicating the reference or 0 year of the age depth model.

codeDefinition.definition: Year zero is set as the core's collection year.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any submitter defined notes on how the age depth model was created.
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.

Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating average annual salinity (Note: Palustrine and freshwater should only include tidal wetlands, or wetlands that are potentially/formerly tidal but artificially freshened due to artificial tidal restrictions).
Indicate whether salinity_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Salinity inferred by field observation such as vegetation

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code based on submitter field observations or measurement indicating dominant wetland vegetation type.

codeDefinition.definition: Describes wetlands dominated by woody vegetation < or equal to 5 meters in height
Describes wetlands dominated by woody vegetation > 5 meters in height
Dominated by forested to scrub/shrub biomass

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether vegetation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Vegetation inferred by field observation

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating how often the coring location is inundated.

codeDefinition.definition: Study-specific definition of an elevation relatively high in the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type
Study-specific definition of an elevation in the relative middle of the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type
Study-specific definition of an elevation in relatively low in the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether inundation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Inundation inferred by field observation such as vegetation

attribute.attributeDefinition: Core identification code unique to each site.
Year of core collection.
Numeric month of year of core collection.
Numeric day of month of core collection.
Positional latitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Positional longitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Code indicating how latitude and longitude were determined.

codeDefinition.definition: Conventional Commercially available hand-held GPS

attribute.attributeDefinition: Habitat classification of the sampled location based on description or dominate vegetation.

codeDefinition.definition: Tropical and dominated by specialized shrubs or trees.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicated whether or not the coring team believes they recovered a full sediment profile, down to bedrock, or other non-marsh interface.

codeDefinition.code: core depth limited by length of corer
codeDefinition.definition: The total depth of the core was limited by the length of the coring device
Authors report that the depth of the core represents the depth of the wetland soil deposit

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Unique identification code used to distinguish cores or sampling intervals that were collected or processed using different methods.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Minimum depth of a sampling increment.
Maximum depth of a sampling increment.
Minimum depth of a soil horizon of which the sample is representative.
Maximum depth of a soil horizon of which the sample is representative.
Sample identification unique to the core. This should be used in the case that there are relevant lab specific sample codes, or in the case that there are multiple replicate samples.
Dry mass per unit volume of a soil sample. This does not include ash free bulk density.
Mass of organic matter relative to sample dry mass. Ash free bulk density should not be used here but should be expressed as a loss on ignition fraction.
Mass of carbon relative to sample dry mass.
Any submitter generated notes on compaction.
Radiocarbon age as estimated from AMS measurements.
Estimated uncertainty in c14_age.
Description of the material selected for radiocarbon (14C) dating.
Any relevant submitter generated notes on 14C dating process.
The isotopic signature of 13C. This is oftentimes measured along with c14_age and can be useful for analyzing carbon lability and provenance.
Most likely, median, or mean age of the depth interval from submitter generated age depth model.
Minimum age of the depth interval from submitter generated age depth model.
Maximum age of the depth interval from submitter generated age depth model.
Standard error of age estimate from submitter generated age depth model.
Any other submitter generated notes specific to the depth interval.
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Code indicating any major anthropogenic impacts historically and currently affecting the coring location.

codeDefinition.definition: No disturbance or management has occurred.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Habitat classification of the sampled location based on description or dominate vegetation.

codeDefinition.definition: Tropical and dominated by specialized shrubs or trees.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code associated with a species or a vegetation assemblage.
Defines whether the code refers to a description, or level of plant taxonomy.

codeDefinition.definition: Refers to taxonomic Genus and species.

unit.name: nominalMonth
unit.description: one month excluding leap seconds and leap days, 2628000 seconds
